title: Spent over probably $1000 Dollars on this account for them to perma ban me?
body: Me calling someone bad somehow is complete toxicity and worth banning my account that i have spent a fortune on. How is this even legal? LOL

replies.body:
You spending an absurd amount of money doesn't make you immune to the rule, it became legal when you agreed to follow the summoners code when you first joined the game - which states your account is subject to be revoked from your control unless you can follow the rules.

Post your chatlogs and the boards will judge if it's justified or not

Well they basically stole money then if i paid for something and then they take it away with no reimbursement

You know how in the entertainment industry, you get your entertainment but if you so somethinf stupid, they don't have to reimburse you? Same idea.

Also, you had previous punishments.

Let's say you buy a really nice car - a Tesla, we'll say.

You then proceed to show your friends how fast it can go, how powerful and quiet it is, and *ZOMG* you run into a tree with it. Tesla is not liable for you breaking the product and making it unusable.

As another example, let's say you go to a theme park and purchase a ticket, one of the conditions of entry being "no cutting in line". While they may give you a warning once, they will kick you out - and you don't get reimbursed for your ticket. You agreed to certain conditions when you bought the product, and you violated those conditions.
If you break something, the company doesn't have to reimburse you for what you broke. That's essentially what you did with this account.
Stole? You paid for the stuff yourself.

You pay for a car, you crash the car, the dealership does not have to reimburse you.

Same difference here.

It's not stealing. 
For example, if I paid $800 every month for access to a VIP gym but constantly insulted everyone around me, I could easily get kicked out without reimbursement. It's not the amount of money you spend, but if you can follow the rules or not. 
You're paying for skins, not for ban immunity.
Good analogy! I like the way this was said

I think an important concept to cover here is the fact you don't own anything you actually purchase in this game. You are given access to the virtual goods, which can be removed at any time for any reason. It is unfortunate you decided to exhibit constant toxic behavior and lost an account you spent so much money on but you had plenty of warning and chose to continue breaking the rules.

>Me calling someone bad somehow is complete toxicity and worth banning my account that i have spent a fortune on.

 You were warned multiple times that your behavior was problematic and in violation of the rules. 

A permanent suspension shouldn't have come as a surprise, especially given that your most recent reform card **specifically** said "_Any_ continued negativity will result in a permanent suspension."


>How is this even legal? LOL

 Because of the [Terms of Use/Terms of Service](https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse) you agreed to adhere to.
